timeline.message:
Simplify JNI init code

Motivation:

Using classes which are not provided by the JDK itself in JNI is
problematic when shading may be used by customers of the library. Also
it makes the maintainance of the code often more complicated.

Modifications:

- Only us classes which are provided by the JDK in the JNI code
- Cleanup

Result:

Easier to maintain code

timeline.bodyText:
Idea is nice: I would just put somewhere the expected (constant) named indexes of the parameters.
If exposed that would help users a bit (although won't rely on the order/value of them)
timeline.author: franz1981

replies.bodyText: sure I can do...  That said its all "internal" so not sure if it really matters and is worth the effort.
replies.author: normanmaurer

replies.bodyText: Matter of taste, indeed: the simplification is welcome anyway :) well done
replies.author: franz1981

replies.bodyText: lets just keep it like this for now... If needed we can it later
replies.author: normanmaurer

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think we need to pass the ringFd twice here or submissionQueueRingSize, and we can pass completionQueueRingEntries instead of completionQueueRingSize.
i.e. number of args can be reduced by 2
timeline.author: njhill

replies.bodyText: I think it would better to pass the ringFd to the RingBuffer
replies.author: 1Jo1

replies.bodyText: forget it, as sqe and cqe require ring_fd :)
replies.author: 1Jo1

replies.bodyText: I would prefer to keep it mostly as it is for clarity.
replies.author: normanmaurer
